decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This development shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings and specifications, unless approved otherwise in writing by the local planning authority.  
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
Condition : 3 - The external materials to be used in the approved development shall match those of the existing building.
In the interest of the appearance of the development, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.
Condition : 4 - The rooflights hereby approved, shall be of a conservation area specification i.e. in-line and flush within the roof pitch that they would be located.
In the interests of preserving the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with Council policies DMS1 and DMS2.
Condition : 5 - A method statement for repairs and external works to the front elevation shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval before these works commence. The repair of the roughcast render shall be done like-for-like in lime with aggregates to match the existing. The paint shall be removed from the ground floor of the front elevation using the DOFF method. Re-pointing of the brickwork to the front elevation shall be done in lime, with the pointing flush with the brickwork and rag-finished to give a traditional appearance.

In the interest of the appearance of the development, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 and DMS2.
Condition : 6 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Erection of rear dormer roof extension and front rooflights to main roof ; Erection of single-storey rear extension.
